description: In tense Council discussions following the reveal of erased citizen testimonies, Directorate leaders push Nikola Petrak to authorize an emergency rollback of the BCI to prevent further unrest and data exposure.

Nikola Petrak signs off on the Directorate’s emergency reset plan, officially authorizing the purge of all BCI code linked to Halden. Plans for public tribunals are shelved in favor of rapid restoration of control.

Directorate teams begin executing the reset, entering key Stenograd data centers to purge Halden’s code and revert vital systems to their earlier protocols, despite warnings of potential service instability.

Stenograd’s residents experience abrupt changes in access to housing, jobs, and services. Some are abruptly locked out, while others regain benefits lost under BCI. Confusion and resentment rise as the system lurches into its old structure.

Citizens gather in the streets demanding answers, while provisional guidelines are issued warning that services will remain unreliable. Trust in the Council continues to erode as calls for a new model of governance grow louder.
